The claim made by Tom Steyer that: Since 1978, California has spent $5 billion to put 13 people to death" is being questioned.
The Yes on 62 campaign: which supports the abolition of the death penalty, has used the $5 billion estimate in their argument.
The: 5 billion figure is an updated estimate by Paula Mitchell, one of the authors of a report by California's Loyola Law School in 2011 on the cost of the death penalty system.
Mitchell clarifies that the: 5 billion represents the total amount spent on California's entire death penalty system since 1978, not just on the 13 executions.
